title.narrative: F.a: Expansion of Community Based Responses in Preventing Violence Against Children

description.narrative: Workshop on children's rights, education, information, teaching materials. Violence against children is a serious problem in Uganda, and it is happening at home, at school, at work, and in the context at child trafficking and child prostitution. The actual number of cases is expected to exceed clearly in reported cases. Corporal punishment is a problem, for example, 81% of school pupils in 2011, was forced to physical punishments. A significant proportion of victims of violence are girls. In particular, gir ls experience sexual violence. Economic and social barriers make it difficult to access to justice. Authors are often family members, neighbors or teachers. Child prostitution has increased from 2004 to 2011. Poverty increases child labor, which in turn in creases the chances of to be a victim of violence.The project aims to raise awareness and to establish mechanisms to enable to reduce violence against children in the Rwenzori region of Western Uganda. The aim is to raise awareness of children's rights vio lations, discussion about them between local leaders and community members and increase activities to reduce the violence against children, victim services, as well as better involvement of children in violence prevention. The direct target group are legal advisers (one young and one adult per controller), the new and old support groups of the children's rights, local leaders , journalists and about 9 000 other community members who are involved in the project activities. In addition, the target group cons ists of 30 schools with their pupil and teachers. The indirect benefits of the project are the family members of the primary target groups, as well as radio- listeners a wider area. In addition, Joy for Children?s workers the employees will benefit direct ly from the project's training . Joy for Children Uganda was established in 2005 and registered in 2006. Organization's vision is a society free of violations of children's rights in which all children have equal opportunities .
